author: protolambda
content: Another problem is that clients prune away non-finalized chains, so reconstructing the whole event will be quite difficult

author: protolambda
content: And although we're now building something to monitor the network more closely, at the time we didn't monitor extensively beyond eth2stats, and our own nodes. And each node has their own point of view, with different forks, due to the following sync problems after the event. So it's hard to say exactly how many nodes went out, and which forks were made.

author: protolambda
content:
The idea is relatively simple though:
- create 1 peerstore
- create N hosts, using the same peerstore
- make the hosts crawl the network, with the many p2p commands in there, including some specifically for polling
- peerstore is updated like in any normal libp2p app
- peerstore changes are tee'd: like the common linux tool, just pipe the same changes to a log, with support for different formats, and soon streaming to external server

author: protolambda
content: And the evcsv/evjson formats translate the peerstore structure into something more readable and structured, for easier processing.
